Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as ACTION.medication for this purpose.

at0091.1.description: The type of device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study.
at0091.1.comment: This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended. For example, the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM.

at0055.1.description: Simple description about the body site or region targetted for imaging.
at0055.1.comment: If the 'Target site' is specified by a code in the 'Test name', then this field may be redundant. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR.

at0004.1.description: The name of the imaging examination performed.
at0004.1.comment: Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes or RadLex Playbook. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung von Informationen zu einem signifikanten klinischen Befund, der durch radiologische Bildgebungsverfahren identifiziert wurde.
de.use:
Wird verwendet, um Details zu einem einzelnen signifikanten positiven oder negativen klinischen Befund darzustellen, der durch radiologische Bildgebungsverfahren identifiziert wurde und nicht anderweitig in bestimmten Archetypen zur bildgebenden Untersuchung pro Körperstelle modelliert wird.

Dieser Archetyp wurde so konzipiert, dass er in den SLOT „Bildgebende Befunde strukturiert“ des Archetyps OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result oder in eine der relevanten CLUSTER.imaging_exam-Archetypenfamilie verschachtelt werden kann. Er kann aber auch, sofern klinisch angemessen, in anderen ENTRY- oder CLUSTER-Archetypen verwendet werden. Während übliche Befunde, die erwartet und mit jeder Körperstelle assoziiert sind, explizit in der CLUSTER.imaging_exam-spezialisierter Archetypenfamilie modelliert werden, bietet dieser Archetyp ein generisches Muster, um einfache Details zu jedem signifikanten klinischen Befund an jeder Körperstelle zu modellieren.
de.misuse: Darf nicht verwendet werden, um klinische Befunde darzustellen, die bereits im speziellen CLUSTER.imaging_exam-Archetyp modelliert wurden, der für die bestimmte Körperstelle relevant ist.

sv.purpose: *To record details about a significant clinical finding identified by radiological imaging techniques, not otherwise modelled in specific imaging examination archetypes per body site. (en)
sv.use:
*Use to record details about a single significant positive or negative clinical finding identified by radiological imaging techniques, and not otherwise modelled in specific imaging examination archetypes per body site.

This archetype has been designed to be nested within the 'Imaging findings' SLOT in the OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result or in one of the relevant CLUSTER.imaging_exam family of archetypes, but can also be used within other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate. While common findings anticipated and associated with each body site are modelled explicitly in the the CLUSTER.imaging_exam family of specialised archetypes, this archetype provides a generic pattern to model simple details about any significant clinical finding at any body site. (en)
sv.misuse: *Not to be used to record clinical findings already modelled within the family of specialised CLUSTER.imaging_exam archetypes relevant for the identified body site. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere signifikante kliniske funn som er tolket via radiologiske bildeteknikker, som et alternativ til å bruke egne arketyper for radiologisvar per kroppsområde eller organ.
nb.use:
Bruk for å registrere detaljer om et enkelt signifikant positiv eller negativt klinisk funn som er tolket via radiologisk bildeteknikker, som et alternativ til å bruke egne arketyper for radiologisvar per kroppsområde.

Denne arketypen er designet for å bli nøstet inn i SLOT'et "Strukturerte funn" i arketypen OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result (Bildediagnostisk svar), eller i en av de relevante arketypene innen gruppen av CLUSTER.imaging_exam-arketyper. Den kan også bli brukt i en annen ENTRY eller CLUSTER-arketype der det er klinisk formålstjenlig. Denne arketypen legger til rette for å registrere enkle detaljer om ethvert signifikant funn ved alle kroppsområder eller organ, i motsetning til de spesialiserte arketypene for de funn man forventer ved hvert kroppsområde eller organ, og som er modellert i en gruppe av spesialiserte arketyper av typen CLUSTER.imaging_exam.
nb.misuse: Skal ikke brukes for å registrere kliniske funn som tilhører i gruppen av spesialiserte CLUSTER.imaging_exam-arketyper som er modellert for det identifiserte kroppsområde eller organ.

at0024.1.description: Identification of the significant clinical finding, by name.
at0024.1.comment: Coding with an external terminology is strongly recommended. For example: free fluid; or abscess.

at0028.1.description: Narrative description about the observed clinical finding.
